review.reviewBody: The Veggie Matcha Sunomono was a delightful dance of flavors—a refreshing waltz for the palate that left my taste buds swooning. The Inarizushi, on the other hand, was a sweet and salty serenade; the tofu, as fluffy as a cloud, yet crispy enough to keep things interesting. Inside, rice that was sticky with just the right hint of vinegar to make you pucker with pleasure. As for the Gyoza, though they may have spent a few too many moments in the sauna, their flavor was still worth every crispy, blackened second. Overcooked? Perhaps. Overjoyed? Absolutely!
best sushi ever from a picky sushi lover
Avocado on the sushi was black. Poorly made and falling apart. Quality has gone downhill.
Best sushi ever! Our fav spot!
Taste was off and seemed like they threw left over rolls into the container. Never had a bad experience here and I'm kind of shocked.
